description: NIST 800-53 Rev 5 Control-to-Evidence Mappings - Maps each control to its specific, appropriate evidence types

metadata.author: CompliNist Evidence Mapping System
metadata.notes: Evidence items are control-specific. Policy controls (-1 suffix) require policy/procedure documents. Technical controls require technical artifacts.

policy.description: Policy and Procedures controls (typically ending in -1)

technical.description: Technical implementation controls requiring system configurations and logs

operational.description: Operational controls requiring procedures and records

management.description: Management controls requiring plans and assessments

AC-1.intent: Establish and maintain access control policy and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Formal policy document defining access control requirements, roles, and responsibilities
Step-by-step procedures for implementing access control requirements
Documentation of periodic policy reviews and updates
Signed approval from designated official authorizing the policy
Evidence that policy was distributed to relevant personnel

AC-2.intent: Manage system accounts including creation, enabling, modification, disabling, and removal

suggestedEvidence.description: Documented procedures for account lifecycle management
Current listing of all system accounts with roles and permissions
Documentation of account creation approvals
Records of periodic account reviews and recertifications
Documentation of account disabling upon personnel changes

AC-3.intent: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources

suggestedEvidence.description: Access Control List configurations from systems, firewalls, and applications
Role-based access control role definitions and assignments
Matrices showing user/role to resource access mappings
System logs showing access enforcement decisions
Results of testing access enforcement mechanisms

AC-4.intent: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling information flow within and between systems

suggestedEvidence.description: Firewall rules controlling information flow between network segments
Diagrams showing network zones and information flow paths
Documentation of authorized data flows and their controls
Results from testing information flow enforcement

AC-5.intent: Separate duties of individuals to prevent malicious activity

suggestedEvidence.description: Matrix identifying incompatible duties and current assignments
Formal definitions of roles with segregated responsibilities
Analysis showing no single individual has conflicting access
Reports identifying and remediating any SoD violations

AC-6.intent: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses necessary for users

suggestedEvidence.description: Analysis of user privileges showing alignment with job functions
List of privileged accounts with justifications
Documentation of access rights assigned to each role
Records of periodic privilege reviews

AC-7.intent: Enforce a limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts

suggestedEvidence.description: System configuration showing lockout thresholds and durations
Sample audit logs showing failed logon tracking
Test results demonstrating lockout mechanism works

AC-8.intent: Display an approved system use notification message before granting access

suggestedEvidence.description: Screenshots of system use notification banners displayed at login
Approved banner text content reviewed by legal/management
System configuration showing banner implementation

AC-17.intent: Control and monitor methods for remote access to the system

suggestedEvidence.description: Documented requirements for remote access
VPN gateway configuration showing security controls
Logs showing remote access monitoring
List of users authorized for remote access

AC-18.intent: Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption

suggestedEvidence.description: Wireless access point security configuration
Documentation of required wireless security standards (WPA3, etc.)
Inventory of authorized wireless devices

AC-19.intent: Establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for mobile devices

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy for mobile device usage and security requirements
Mobile Device Management configuration and enrolled devices
Inventory of authorized mobile devices

AU-1.controlName: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
AU-1.intent: Develop, document, and disseminate audit and accountability policy and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Formal policy document defining audit requirements
Procedures for audit log management and review
Documentation of policy reviews and updates
Approval signature from appropriate authority

AU-2.intent: Identify events that need to be logged and coordinate logging across the organization

suggestedEvidence.description: Documented list of events the system is configured to log
System configuration showing event logging settings
Sample logs demonstrating events are being captured

AU-3.intent: Ensure audit records contain sufficient information for forensic analysis

suggestedEvidence.description: Documentation of required audit record fields
Sample logs showing required content (who, what, when, where, outcome)
Configuration showing audit record content settings

AU-6.controlName: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
AU-6.intent: Review and analyze system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity

suggestedEvidence.description: Documented procedures for log review and analysis
Schedule showing frequency of audit reviews
Sample reports from audit log reviews
Screenshots of SIEM alerts and monitoring dashboards

AU-12.intent: Provide audit record generation capability for auditable events

suggestedEvidence.description: System configuration showing audit generation settings
List of systems/components generating audit records
Sample audit records from each configured source

CA-1.controlName: Assessment, Authorization, and Monitoring Policy and Procedures
CA-1.intent: Develop and document security assessment and authorization policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining assessment and authorization requirements
Procedures for conducting security assessments
Documentation of policy approval

CA-7.intent: Develop and implement a continuous monitoring strategy

suggestedEvidence.description: Documented strategy for ongoing security monitoring
Configuration of continuous monitoring tools
Sample monitoring reports and dashboards
Configuration of monitoring alerts and thresholds

CM-1.intent: Develop, document, and disseminate configuration management policy and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Formal CM policy document
Procedures for configuration control and change management
Documentation of policy approval and reviews

CM-2.intent: Develop and maintain baseline configurations for information systems

suggestedEvidence.description: Documented baseline configurations for system types
Actual configuration settings from systems
Reports showing any deviations from baseline

CM-6.intent: Establish and document configuration settings for system components

suggestedEvidence.description: Standards defining required configuration settings
Exported configurations from systems showing compliance
Scan results showing configuration compliance

CM-7.intent: Configure systems to provide only essential capabilities

suggestedEvidence.description: Documentation of essential system functions
List of disabled/removed unnecessary services
Documentation of restricted ports and protocols

CM-8.intent: Develop and maintain an inventory of system components

suggestedEvidence.description: Complete inventory of hardware components
Complete inventory of installed software
Reports from automated inventory tools

CP-1.intent: Develop, document, and disseminate contingency planning policy and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Formal policy for contingency planning
Procedures for contingency operations
Documentation of policy approval

CP-9.intent: Conduct backups of system-level and user-level information

suggestedEvidence.description: Configuration of backup systems and schedules
Logs showing successful backup completion
Results from backup restoration testing

IA-1.controlName: Identification and Authentication Policy and Procedures
IA-1.intent: Develop and document identification and authentication policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining identification and authentication requirements
Procedures for user authentication
Documentation of policy approval

IA-2.intent: Uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users

suggestedEvidence.description: Configuration of authentication systems (AD, LDAP, etc.)
Multi-factor authentication configuration
Sample logs showing authentication events
System configuration showing password requirements
Standards for authenticator strength and management
Configuration showing secure credential storage

IR-1.intent: Develop and document incident response policies and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining incident response requirements
Procedures for detecting, responding to, and reporting incidents
Documentation of policy approval

IR-4.intent: Implement an incident handling capability for security incidents

suggestedEvidence.description: Detailed procedures for incident handling
Playbooks for common incident types
Anonymized sample incident reports showing process

MA-1.intent: Develop and document system maintenance policies and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining maintenance requirements
Procedures for conducting system maintenance
Documentation of policy approval

MP-1.intent: Develop and document media protection policies and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining media protection requirements
Procedures for media handling and sanitization
Documentation of policy approval

PE-1.controlName: Physical and Environmental Protection Policy and Procedures
PE-1.intent: Develop and document physical security policies and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining physical protection requirements
Procedures for physical access control
Documentation of policy approval

PL-1.intent: Develop and document security planning policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining security planning requirements
Procedures for security plan development and maintenance
Documentation of policy approval

PS-1.intent: Develop and document personnel security policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining personnel security requirements
Procedures for screening, termination, and transfers
Documentation of policy approval

RA-1.intent: Develop and document risk assessment policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining risk assessment requirements
Procedures for conducting risk assessments
Documentation of policy approval

RA-5.intent: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system

suggestedEvidence.description: Configuration of vulnerability scanning tools
Recent vulnerability scan results
Documentation of vulnerability remediation

SA-1.controlName: System and Services Acquisition Policy and Procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining acquisition security requirements
Procedures for secure acquisition
Documentation of policy approval

SC-1.controlName: System and Communications Protection Policy and Procedures
SC-1.intent: Develop and document system protection policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining system and communications protection
Procedures for implementing protection mechanisms
Documentation of policy approval

SC-7.intent: Monitor and control communications at external and internal boundaries

suggestedEvidence.description: Diagram showing system boundaries and protection points
Firewall rules at boundary points
Results from boundary protection testing

SC-8.intent: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information

suggestedEvidence.description: Configuration of encryption for data in transit
Certificate configurations for encrypted communications
Results from testing transmission encryption

SC-13.intent: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect information

suggestedEvidence.description: Documentation of approved cryptographic algorithms
System configuration showing encryption implementation
Procedures for cryptographic key management

SC-28.intent: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of information at rest

suggestedEvidence.description: Configuration showing encryption of stored data
Standards for encrypting data at rest
Report showing what data is encrypted

SI-1.controlName: System and Information Integrity Policy and Procedures
SI-1.intent: Develop and document integrity policies and procedures

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining system and information integrity requirements
Procedures for maintaining system integrity
Documentation of policy approval

SI-2.intent: Identify, report, and correct system flaws

suggestedEvidence.description: Procedures for identifying and applying patches
Current patch status across systems
Records of patch testing before deployment
Configuration of malware protection tools
Evidence of current malware definitions
Reports of detected and remediated malware

SI-4.intent: Monitor the system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks

suggestedEvidence.description: Configuration of IDS/IPS and monitoring tools
Documentation showing what systems are monitored
Configuration of security alerts and thresholds
Sample monitoring reports and dashboards

SR-1.controlName: Supply Chain Risk Management Policy and Procedures
SR-1.intent: Develop and document supply chain risk management policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining supply chain risk management requirements
Procedures for managing supply chain risks
Documentation of policy approval

AT-1.controlName: Awareness and Training Policy and Procedures
AT-1.intent: Develop and document security awareness and training policies

suggestedEvidence.description: Policy defining training requirements
Procedures for delivering and tracking training
Documentation of policy approval

AT-2.intent: Provide security literacy training to users

suggestedEvidence.description: Records showing user training completion
Current security awareness training content
Schedule for required training

policyControls.description: Controls ending in -1 are typically policy controls

technicalControls.description: Technical controls require system configurations and technical artifacts

policy_document.name: Policy Document
policy_document.description: Formal policy document approved by management

system_logs.name: System Logs
system_logs.description: Audit logs and system event records

screenshots.name: Screenshots
screenshots.description: Visual evidence of system configurations or settings

audit_reports.name: Audit Reports
audit_reports.description: Reports from security audits or assessments
